Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: It seems like everytime it rains or if it is cold I have more aches than usually. This whole winter I really felt it in my bones. When it is nice outside I feel much better. Am i crazy??? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Can rain and cold weather contribute bone aches? stellaratovsky blainejennifer

Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: I don't know how much more of this I could take. I was diagnosed with bone mets in the beginning of May. I started my treatment right away I have been feeling great. Maybe the Meds are working. I went to my regular family doctor just to check everything else and he did blood work. I get a phone call today. He is telling me to get an ultra sound on my abdominal because my blood level was a bit high. Normal is 104 mine came back as 119. The doctor told me not to worry. He said he is 99% sure it's nothing. This doctor awesome he is not the onc but he is the doctor who found my original lump in 2009 and he is the doctor who also send me for pet scans and bone scans. He is very careful. He checks everything. If he says it should be fine and he thinks I am 99% fine. Should I get into panic mode or it should be fine. I am 40 years old and my body is just going through a roller coster. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: If it's not ine thing it's always something else stellaratovsky stellaratovsky

Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: This must sound stupid but how do I know if the medicine is working.  How long do we wait for scans?  I was diagnosed in mid May I feel alot better know since they switched all my meds.  They took me of tomaxafin and put me on Fasladox and Femara.  I have to say I dont have the pain I had before.  I feel like I am in a new body.   Could it be that the tumors are either shrinking or just not growing any bigger.  Before I was diagnosed I could not get out of bed without help.  I walked holding my walls and the pain would not let me sleep mostly at night.  But since all the meds were changed I feel like I was born again I actually started to live again. Log in to post a reply

I need a break and some good news I can't take anymore of this. I am so sorry to rant because I know some people have worse issues but how much can a person take before throwing in the towl. Posts.Title: Life really sucks stellaratovsky Teen22

Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: It's been a depressing morning. I was diagnosed with bone mets in may as I thought I was a bit better pain was fading marker are manageable all other blood work was great. I was stable for 3 months. After my Thursday appointment all the happiness is down the drain. my back starting to act up again not as bad as the first time around it is actually manageable. But was stressed me out was my tumor makers went up to around 600. It was never low but it was always like 239,293, 337, 244 and know 600. All other tests are good like circulating cell search from 4 it went to one and other things that were high are lower know. I am confused what is going on. Another thing I have scans this week very worried. I am just scared. I put up a front in front of my kids but when look at them My heart hurts for everything they are going through. I need to stay strong for them. It is so wrong that my ilness affects them like that. I feel like I am taiin there child hoods away. I am just taking and taking I need to shut up. Did anyone here ever have there tumor markers jump like mine and get up to 600 and still be ok on scans. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Life really sucks stellaratovsky Teen22

Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: I have been living with mets to the bone going on 2 years in May.  I tried a lot of different treatments and currently I am on a/a which was great to me my tm went from 2000 to about 200.  Know it's been jumping by bit much but I still feel great.  I am able to work full time and take care of my family.  With side effects of a/a you get mouth sores and a lot of achne especially on my head.  I have been picking the aching I know should not do it but it's really bothering me.  When I went to my doctor I told him about picking it and it turned into a red bump.  So when he looked at it he said he wants to biopsy it.  Which will happen tomorrow.  I am so scared crazy thoughts are going through my head.  He thinks it's a met on the skin of the sculp.  It's really small but he is not sure it could be an infection from picking it.  Has anyone had this??  So he tells me not to worry worst case he will switch me to zoloda and it will take care of this problem if it's a met to skin. I am confused and scared I really don't have anyone to talk to about this at home because they don't really get it.  Just as I get use to the fact I have bone mets only and try to live normal this comes up how do u deal??? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Confused and scared stellaratovsky GatorGal

Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: Well it's been a little over a year since I was diagnosed with bones. I already had one progression in November. I am pretty sure there is another one. I have a petscan to tomorrow. (so scared). Please pray for me. I have not beenfeeling well at all so much bone pain. Te pain is so bad I was considering jumping in front of a car to put myself out of the misery. But than I think of my boys and what my onc said that I have so many options still. I am 99 percent sure I will start a/a combo. As scared as I was I really want to start it hopefully it helps with the pain. I need quality of life. I don't know but for some reason it seems Like everything hurts . All the horrible thoughts. I am sorry to rant I am just scared scans tomorrow new treatment. I hope that this treatment I was on would work for years I guess I was kidding myself. How many of u switched treatments before the right one came along?? Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Uncontrolled pain stellaratovsky stellaratovsky

Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: I have not been on here for a while. I needed a much needed break. Sometimes it gets too much. I did miss you all and I wanted to give you all a bit of update. I was switched to A/A treatment back in July and thank god. I have tolerated it very well. Don't get me wrong I did have some side effects but nothing I could not handle. But good news I really think its working I do not have pain and I am getting my life back slowly. Oh my tumor markings went from 2000 to 108 as if last week. Woohoo for that. My onc. Is really happy with the treatment plan and I am up for scans next month. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: anyone have a oophrectomy done stellaratovsky stellaratovsky

Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: I have been Afintor and extemeste for 1 year this July.  I really think it's time to say good bye.  I knew this was coming but was not sure when.  I am in so much pain from my lower back to shoulder, my whole body hurts my doctor is putting me xeloda I hope it works for a long time it seems that most meds been working for about a year like  faslidex, Femara, afintor, extemestine.   I am so tired of all changes it just gets to depressing.  I know I should be grateful for things I have but living in constant fear is no joke.  Like everyone says it gets easier.  Easier for a little while than back to the fear factor.  I am not so much scared of me dying I am scared for my kids, husband and parents.  What will happen to my boys how will my husband manage to pay all bills and college tuition.  I still work my income is a huge plus.  I am scared for them.  They are the ones who will have to live with all the change.  I am just so down the last couple of days.... Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: Well my liver has improved by a lot. But know my lympnotes around the Kidney area was bad. I had to put in 2 stents. Did anyone else have this done? This is so painful I had it done today. When i pea you feel like dying and my whole bottom area around my uterist is killing me. They put 2 stents so it will give it a good flow for all the garbage come out. I am blessed to have my onc who is so on top of me but it gets to much. This disease is just hurting me. I am 43 years old and I don't have a happy day. I don't want to live in consistant pain. Sometimes I wonder if it is worth it. I love life my kids, husband family but it gets too much when you can't enjoy the things you love. I feel like burden at times they say I am crazy. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: More crazy updates when does it end.. stellaratovsky RosesToeses

Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: I have been having a rough couple of weeks just did my pet scan and after being stable for 4 months there are more areas lit up. It is still only in my bones but femara is not working for me. The doctor is adding faslodex. He thinks this will work. I am at a point in life were I don't know if I could take any of this anymore. He said I should be ok and I still could get to stable but we have to see how the Meds work. I am scared I am not ready to die yet I have two kids that need me. My tumor markings went from 236 to almost 700. Is there hope for me yet. I dont think anyone understands how we feel only the women on this site. Has anyone had it really bad and it fixed it self to better. I know I will not get cured but I am hoping to be stable again. sorry for all the rambling. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Rough couple of weeks stellaratovsky stellaratovsky

Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: I have to say that since I started my new medicine (femara, fasladox, zometa and lupron). I have to say my body is not in pain like it was. Could it be that the Meds are finally kicking in? The only concern is pain in my leg which is manageable but stil there. The pain before all the meds was in my lower back, hip and the whole leg. I am grateful that the pain went down to one area the thigh area but no so bad? My first visit with onc this Thursday since I started all new Meds. What should I ask j am new to this ??? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Body feels better stellaratovsky stellaratovsky

Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: Well I am approaching 2 years next week so much has happened.  I learned not to take life for granted that's for sure.  I get to see my oldest son graduate high school in June and I see him go to prom.  Thank u god so much for that.  I still have my little guy to raise hopefully things continue to go well.  Living with cancer taught me to be more aware.  It kinda sucks living from scan to scan but we have no choice.  I had a lot of great days and lots of really bad days were I could not get out of bed.  Also to see so many sister who have passed just breaks my heart.  When that happens I take a little break from the boards I guess I am not strong enough to handle it.  Even though I personally never met these women I take it very personally and I can't help but think about them and there family's. I guess I am bit uptight today.  But on a good note I am alive still working and being with my family.  And may they continue to come out with great things for all of us.  Hugs to all.... Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: stellaratovsky wrote: These boards are the only place I could turn to for answers. It is getting harder and harder to log in. I don't know what to expect so many women have passed away this year alone from this horrible disease. It's hard to handle. We all have become a family and when one passes away my heart breaks. It is so sad and unfair. Sometimes I wonder if this is just a horrible dream and than I wake up to reality. Ever ach and pain that has nothing to do with cancer scares me. I think I am paranoid. I am sorry for all the ranting it just gets harder and harder to deal with this illness. Today is just a really bad day I can't stop crying. Log in to post a reply
